result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey D Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 154 days were granted.

Comply with Anger management counseling. Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment as deemed appropriate. 
Sex offender treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.
Register as a sex offender.

No Contact with victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a GED/HSED. AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the motion for relief is denied dated 9-29-17 from the Wisconsin Court of Appeals

IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on February 22, 2017, that:
IT IS ORDERED that he judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved from further representing Rickey D. Howard in this matter.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

IT IS ORDERED that the defendant-appellant's packet of documents received on April 5, 2017, is deemed to be a statement in support of his petition and is accepted for filing. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the clerk of this court is directed to provide a copy of the April 5, 2017 filing to defendant-appellant under separate cover so he may serve it on the plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin. The clerk is neither required nor authorized to serve papers on behalf of litigants. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time for plaintiff-respondent to file a response to the petition for review shall commence on the later of the date of this order or the date or service.

IT IS ORDERED that the motion for extension of time is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 28, 2017. Defendant-appellant may file on copy of the statement in support. Defendant-appelant is reminded, however, that he remains solely responsible for serving a copy of his statement in support of the Attorney General, as the clerk of this court is neither required nor authorized to serve papers on behalf of litigants. If the statement is not filed by April 28, 2017, this petition will be summarily dismissed. No further time extensions will be granted.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction of summarily affirmed. 

IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved from further representing Rickey D. Howard in this matter.

Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody, with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peirce makes statements regarding Defendant's request for new counsel for sentencing.  Court asks Defendant questions regarding he request here today.  State does not object to Defendant's request.  Court grants Defendant's request for new counsel through the public defender's office.  As soon as new counsel is appointed,  Attorney Peirce is to hand over all materials to that new counsel.  Sentencing date remains on.
Motion hearing on February 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Random list of jurors selected (for alternate to be selected)
7 verdict forms
Exhibits #2, 4 and 5

Case called at 8:43 a.m. for Day 3 of continued 12-person jury trial.  Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody (in street clothes), with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes through jury instructions with counsel.  Jurors enter courtroom at 9:05 a.m.  Court gives jury instructions.  Closing arguments by the state. Closing arguments by Attorney Peirce.  State gives additional statements.  Court gives additional instructions regarding deliberations.  Alternate juror, Gabriella D. is announced and dismissed prior to deliberations.  Jurors exit courtroom to deliberate at 10:20 a.m.  Jurors reach verdict at 11:33 a.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 11:47 a.m.  Court reads verdicts submitted.  Jurors find Defendant guilty on all counts, Counts 1-7 on information.  Court polls the jurors.  Jurors discharged at 11:55 a.m.  State moves for judgment on all counts.  Court grant motion.  Court revokes bail - Defendant remanded to custody of the sheriff.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Sentencing date set.

Case called at 8:38 a.m. for Day 2 on continued 12-person jury trial.  Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody (in street clothes), with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All 13 jurors present and enter courtroom at 8:38 a.m.  Case proceeds to testimony.  Rachel C. sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibit #4 marked.  Cross-examination by Attorney Peirce.  Re-direct by the state.  Re-cross by Attorney Peirce.  Sarah O. sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibit #5 marked. Cross-examination by Attorney Peirce.  Detective Shelly Fischer sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibit #6 marked (DVD of photos) and is viewed in court.  State's Exhibits #7 & 8 marked.  Cross-examination by Attorney Peirce.  Re-direct by the state.  Re-cross-examination by Attorney Peirce.  State rests.  Court takes short break at 10:16 a.m.  Jurors exit courtroom at 10:16 a.m.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #4-8.  Court receives Exhibits #4-8.  Court reconvenes at 10:45 a.m.  Attorney Peirce states that Defendant will not be testifying.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to testify.  Jurors enter courtroom at 10:55 a.m.  State again states that they rest their case.  Defense rests.  Court will adjourn case to tomorrow, 1/8/15 at 8:30 a.m. for jury instructions, closing arguments, and deliberations due to court's obligation to Drug Treatment Court today at 1:00 p.m.  Jurors are excused at 10:59 a.m. and ordered to report back tomorrow at 8:30 a.m.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire List
Random Listing Report

Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody  (in street clothes), with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:45 a.m. for 12 person jury trial.  Potential jurors called for 8:50 a.m.  Potential jurors enter courtroom at 9:10 a.m.  Potential jurors are sworn-in on voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire. Defense states that all questions he had were asked by the court and the state.  Sidebar conducted.  Potential juror Mary Anne A. is struck for cause.  Clerk announces new juror.  State conducts voir dire on new juror.  No questions by defense.  State and Defense exercise 5 strikes each of potential jurors.  12 jurors and 1 alternate juror are selected to try the issues.  Clerk announces 12 jurors and 1 alternate juror as selected.  Remaining jurors at excused at 10:45 a.m.  Clerk gives oath to jurors selected.  Jurors leave courtroom for short break at 10:46 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 11:09 a.m.   Court gives preliminary instructions to jurors.  State gives opening statements.  Attorney Peirce gives opening statements.  Court adjourns for lunch at 11:50 a.m..  Jurors are released and told to return at 1:15 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 1:23 p.m.  Case proceeds to testimony.  Amy P. sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibit #1 marked. Exhibit #1 (DVD with photos) is viewed in court.  State completes direct examination of witness.  Court takes short recess at 2:45 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 3:03 p.m. State moves for admission of Exhibit #1.  Court receives Exhibit #1.  Attorney Peirce cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by the state.  No re-cross-examination.  Kristin C. sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibits #2 & 3 marked.  Exhibit #3 (DVD with photos) is viewed in court.  Cross-examination by Attorney Peirce.  Re-direct by the state.  Court adjourns at 4:40 p.m..  Jurors are instructed to return tomorrow to begin court at 8:30 a.m.  Jurors excused at 4:41 p.m.  State moves Exhibits #2 & 3 into evidence.  Court receives Exhibits #2 & 3.

Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody, with Attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peirce states that he is ready to proceed to trial tomorrow, 1/6/15.  Court addresses motions in limine.  Both parties agree to sequestration of witnesses for the trial and court orders such.  Court finds that one of state's witnesses' prior criminal record is allowed during testimony and appropriate.  Court finds that Defendant's prior criminal record is allowed, if Defendant testifies.  Court will address other acts motion at later time. Court will have 1 alternate juror for trial.  Court addresses issue of service dog request for victim/witness.  Defense objects to request.  State provides additional information regarding request.  Court denies request for service dog to accompany witness due to no documented disabilities noted for witness.  Court grants state's request to utilize other acts evidence.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rickey D Howard in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern and Attorney Debra Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests all witnesses be excluded from the courtroom. Court grants the request. Officer B. Howard from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Retired Detective T. Witzel from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.    Defendant can be returned forthwith. Defendant to appear by video from Milwaukee County Jail for his next hearing.
